website_summaries.verdict: There are few in-canal earphones available that offer the stellar sonic experience of the high-end Shure SE846.
pros: Tons of accessories, including hard shell case, multitude of eartip options, inline volume adapter
Includes ear nozzle pieces to adjust sound signature to personal tastes
cons: Extremely expensive for a non-custom molded pair
No inline remote or phone controls for mobile devices

customer_reviews.title: a good firm tight fitting in ear earbud is required to ...
customer_reviews.text: outstanding soundstage quality, comparable with high end headphones; BUT; a good firm tight fitting in ear earbud is required to obtain the full range of sounds these earphones can reproduce: very expensive but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Had these before and sod them while i Tried the ...
customer_reviews.text: Had these before and sod them while i Tried the westone w60s ect , Now buying them again , If you get a genuine pair They're worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: David Bowers

customer_reviews.title: A different level of sound
customer_reviews.text: I always thought that my SE535s sounded amazing (they still are a very good pair of earphones) but these SE846s sound so much better. The bass is incredible and the mid and high ranges are equally as amazing. Anyone wondering if its worth the upgrade, I will 100% say go for it if you can!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and highly recommended Replacements for first pair that I unfortunately left on a plane
customer_reviews.author: DAVID FOSTER

customer_reviews.title: Very clean and flat
customer_reviews.text: 1. You need a good headphone amp for these. 2. They are very clean with a very flat/neutral response curve. 3. You need to really position these properly in your ear to hear them correctly. 4. The average person won't probably like them because of their neutral response curve. 5. Are they worth $1000? Depends on how much money you have and how much you appreciate clean/flat music.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad8888

customer_reviews.title: Goosebumps
customer_reviews.text: Run through a dragonfly red on plain old iTunes quality music and........goosebumps. Almost every song does that to me now. I've got some hearing loss and I was afraid I wouldn't be able to appreciate the subtlety, not to worry. You'll hear things that you hadn't heard before....just heard someone sniff and clear their throat on the left channel at the beginning of Pink Floyd's "Wish you were here".......Downside? No longer comes with a pelican case and the new case is too small. Other than that....totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: pw armin

customer_reviews.title: Blows the SE 535s Out of the water.
customer_reviews.text: I own the SE 215 and SE 535s, and the contest isn't even close between those and the SE 846. Bass is deep but not overcrowding other frequencies. Sound stage is wide, holy crap its wide; so wide in fact you would not think you were wearing in ear head phones. Treble and mid range are ever present. I hear new things in music that I have listened to over and over before. Instrument have distinct separation and every nuance of the instruments timbre is heard. These can't possible be the exact same drivers found in the SE 535, the difference in sound is just too great!
customer_reviews.author: Randy D.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Coming from over ear headphones like the LCD2, HE-500, and T1, these are impressive. Bass on Aphex Twin's Selected Ambient Works 1 is amazing. Playing through the Sony WMA1 with high gain output.
customer_reviews.author: AeXiPHiXiON

customer_reviews.title: I strongly recommend these SE846
customer_reviews.text: I will never need to search for another pair of Headphones. okay okay now, I use headphones for different purposes wether its checking a line when I'm at FOH or Listening to the Bands Mix in BOH or at home reading or working out intensely. I was surprised on how the highs, Mid's and lows didn't half to compete with one another. And how after wear these for whole 4 hours my ears didnt fatique listening as well as wearing these. I strongly recommend these SE846. The price is what it is but is it worth it. I took a big swallow when i purchased them, but after a week. So worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: The husband is IN LOVE all over again. Tried them out and they are extreme noise canceling. They fit large Caucasian ears perfectly. Comes with 4-5 ear piece types. Does not fit small ears even with the different ear piece types. Husband says these are typically used for professional use by drummers and band members. He uses them for every listening to cancel out crazy kids and noisy co workers in the background. HAHAHAHA highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Christina W

customer_reviews.title: These earphones have extremely awesome sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These earphones have extremely awesome sound quality. The design of the earphones is extremely well made and when you put them in your ear and lay on a pillow they do not cause stress or discomfort to your ear while laying on a pillow. Highly recommend these to anyone who might be thinking about buying them. They have a ton of accessories that come with them too.
customer_reviews.author: Salted37

customer_reviews.title: These put my Shure SE535s to shame -- they sound like garbage next to these SE846
customer_reviews.text: The first earbuds/earphones I have ever purchased at any price that have real and deep bass. Simply unbelievable. Who needs big over the ear headphones if you have these? These put my Shure SE535s to shame -- they sound like garbage next to these SE846. Besides the deep and real bass these earphones have a fantastic separation of sounds. All these separate drivers help to create a real soundstage. These earphones give meaning the the adage that you get what you pay for. The only thing that is not perfect is the cables do not feel quite as sturdy as those on my Shure SE535s. But all told what fantastic sound these have.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Greenspan

customer_reviews.title: Heaven in your ears!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not going to waste a lot of space here. I've had many headphones and earphones over the years, both cheap and expensive. These are the VERY BEST I've ever owned. AMAZING BASS - I mean AMAZING... right out of the box. Don't even need to swap nozzles that come included. If you can swing these, you'll only buy 'em once... no need for anything different, EVER. Heaven.
customer_reviews.author: William B

customer_reviews.title: Shure is not what it used to be I guess
customer_reviews.text: These sounded horrible promptly returned. My 10yr old plus Shure sounded tremendously better than these.
customer_reviews.author: FearlessLeaderB

customer_reviews.title: Bad shopping experience. Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is not a pleasant shopping experience. The earphones sent to me was a Japanese export edition and the included parts are different compared with the US edition. There was no hard plastic case and the whole box is held closed with a small circular scotch tape. I will be returning this product because it does not match up with the descriptions but I will purchase this earphone some where else
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sun

customer_reviews.title: These are hands down the best purchase I have made in the past year because ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I just had to write a review for these. These are hands down the best purchase I have made in the past year because after months of using them I still am surprised by the breathtaking audio quality and fidelity. When I first put them in my ears they actually brought tears to my eyes as I heard things I had never heard before in songs I had had a thousand times before. Even now after owning these for months, I am still taken aback by how incredible these ear buds truly are. On my opinion, these are worth every penny and I have no complaints what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: nolan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in-ear headphones.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. I upgraded my SE215 and wow what a difference. Base is great for inear headphones. Dont think they will be some crazy base like over-the-ear but still for what they do. Sound is clear and great. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing IE headphones. They are comparable to some of the best overhear headphones I have heard. Think Audeze, Sennheiser and Hifiman top line units. They are very articulate with wonderful bass and sweet highs ....slightly rolled off. Shure does a wonderful job packaging these. Highly recommended. Over the top with my home Dac and works great with a Dragonfly Red wjhen your on the run. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Fisher

customer_reviews.title: with my old SE535s I was rather disappointed, but these are truly worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. Yes, it is an in-ear headphone that holds its own against a full-size HD650. Worth every penny, especially with a WooAudio WA7. I really did smile when I first heard these; with my old SE535s I was rather disappointed, but these are truly worth the price. The treble is just crisp enough to not be tiring, and the bass is genuine, rich and never obtrusive. If you appreciate music and have the means, then please do yourself a favor and grab these for yourself today! It will be a completely different world.
customer_reviews.author: The Stig, MD

customer_reviews.title: Sublime
customer_reviews.text: I'm not generally one to write reviews, but ... after I unboxed these today I spent hours listening to music on them including some deep subwoofer test tracks and all I can say is that these earbuds are sublime. The experience is completely transportive. I was certain this was a foolish purchase when placed the order, but I now have absolutely no regrets. Simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Locke B

customer_reviews.title: No longer ships with the "crush and water resistant road case".
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality from the earphones is outstanding and you will not be disappointed if you are listening to others of a lesser quality. They appear to be well made and I expect them to provide years of music enjoyment. The supplied ear sleeves provided an excellent fit for me on a recent 2 hour flight and blocked nearly all outside noise with my music adjusted to a comfortable level. I am looking forward to trying them with my new AK70 MKII.
customer_reviews.author: Killerjoe

customer_reviews.title: I know these are way too much $$. But ...
customer_reviews.text: I know these are way too much $$. But it was worth every penny. These earphones are stunning. Treble as near to perfection as you can get, and Balanced Armatures that actually give clean, clear, low bass. I have others on the high end, but all I want to use are these.
customer_reviews.author: Donald H. Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Coming from TripleFi 10 & 535
customer_reviews.text: Ill keep my review short and say this. If you currently own se535 or Ultimate Ears TripleFi 10 and feel as if the lows are lacking these are for you! Ive never heard bass reproduction done this well for a iem. 100% worth the price, I find myself using these for working out, snowboarding, dirtbiking and they are constructed well. The cable is okay in terms of being rugged and is the same as the one supplied with 535's. Paired with a iphone 6 and soundcloud 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: n00be

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but the sound is tremendous!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of the older SE535's over the years but these sound incredible by comparison. They're a bit more bulky than the 535 but that's hardly an issue considering the outstanding sound they generate. I haven't played with the frequency response nozzles yet but I look forward to seeing if I can detect a significant difference. Outstanding engineering - but you're paying for it.
customer_reviews.author: spinteractive

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound but $$
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is impressive, I hear nuance that is not present on lower cost ear buds,(lost a pair of Westone triple drivers) the bass is clean, deep and tight. Are they worth $1,000.00? that is a judgment call you'll have to make for yourself but worth a listen if you're in the market
customer_reviews.author: RTT

customer_reviews.title: I'm not as pleased with the fit as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm not as pleased with the fit as I expected. I've owned a number of models over the years - this one has slightly longer "tubes" and they don't seat as well as the all the other SE-series. The 535's are amazing enough, and fit excellent.
customer_reviews.author: soundguy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound. Yes, they are expensive, but if you really love incredible sounding music, these are the real deal. I have had Shure SE535s, Westone W4s, Klipsch, etc etc. These are the best. The sound is detailed, accurate and full. The sound stage is awesome. I listen to albums and hear details that i've never heard before. I am very very pleased with the Shure SE846!!
customer_reviews.author: FlyingDoc

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING audio quality
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING audio quality. I have owned the SE110, SE115, SE215, SE315, SE425, SE525 and now the SE846 and can say without a doubt these are the most amazing audio quality. I use them for personal listening, I use my 425's for gym and work. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: S Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound, as clear as using a Dragonfly Red DAC with a pair of Sennheiser HD800s. I just want to know if the se846 earphones were suppose to come with a serial number because I've been trying to find one on the box but didn't see any. I've seen before that these earphones had a s/n but I'm not so sure now. They sound amazing and I don't think a counterfeit would sound amazing as well. Please someone confirm this with me. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Vigil

customer_reviews.title: 3 dimensional earbud sound
customer_reviews.text: Wow. You get what you pay for; save it up if you can't purchase them now.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian aficionado

customer_reviews.title: LCD 2 for home, Shure SE846 when I'm away.
customer_reviews.text: I have LCD 2 at home. But when leave my home, these are the best sounding IEM's. I never had so much fun. Worth the money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Romar N

customer_reviews.title: These are truly amazing..
customer_reviews.text: These are truly amazing........i got them last week and today i switched the little tubes from flat to warm.....blue to black....and the results are really amazing!!! Nice things cost money and these are just splendid.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Shure, you've done it again! Absolutely fantabulous.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic detail. Don't bother me, I'm listening. As an old friend of mine once said, "Bee bop whenever possible"
customer_reviews.author: Tomajj88

customer_reviews.title: Probably Too Expensive But Really Great
customer_reviews.text: Great, great sound. I've had quite a few pairs of headphones and these have the best sound BY FAR. The sound is so clear - truly amazing. The bass is very good - much better than the Shure 400 series. Sound isolation is good. They really are a joy to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Rant

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound but........
customer_reviews.text: These sound great as they should but the cables have a really bad smell to them. I scrubbed them with scented soap and it helped a little but they still smell.I really like the sound and would hate to have to return them. Does anyone have any suggestions? Been afraid to try anything else as I don't want to harm the cables.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard L. Zaikowski

customer_reviews.title: Product switch
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item. Received se215 in se846 box. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Batty

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Earphones
customer_reviews.text: These replace the nearly 3 year old se425s I've been using. Ordered them Amazon Prime, overnight $3.99 shipping...14 hours after the order was placed the package is delivered. And the new packaging is not to be ignored, it's very nice. As for the earphones, Ive been listening to them for about an hour so far...just on a Macbook Air. And all I'll say is: Seriously, be prepared to be blown away. $1000 buys you sonic happiness. They're very LOUD! Crispy clean sound, and the bass explodes--no joke. Everything I've thrown at them sounds incredible...These are amazing earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: This is as good as in-ear sound gets
customer_reviews.text: This is as good as in-ear sound gets. I have owned more different IEMs than the law should allow, and these are in a different class. The bass is everything you have heard abot, but never over-powering.
customer_reviews.author: 11th Tee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing earphones that provides great clarity in music and noise ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing earphones that provides great clarity in music and noise cancellation. It just comes with an annoyingly long cable but can be swapped out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Pang

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely superb I tra war monitors, with superb bass and extended response. Got best results use a balanced cable and a player with balanced headphone output.
customer_reviews.author: JSalcedo

customer_reviews.title: End game IEMs
customer_reviews.text: Over every Genre of music these are amazing, spacious defined crisp across all ranges. Deep defined bass, controlled highs and vivid mid ranges
customer_reviews.author: Panamab7

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: These headphone sound absolutely fantastic. These phones compare well against my Sennheiser HD800, and are a whole lot more portable. Without a doubt the finest IEM I have ever had the pleasure of listening to. If your are serious about Head Fi These Headphones are one of the best sounding phones money can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Metz

customer_reviews.title: Best In Ear Headphones Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have had many, many , many pairs of high end earbuds, and i have to say these are my absolute favorite. the sound is incredibly well balanced and the low end is much more pronounced than the se-535's, it is literally no comparison, but still a very natural balanced sound unlike many of the can headphones out there these days. So if you are an audiophile and love to hear things how they were meant to be heard in incredibly clear detail, these are your headphones. If you are a bashed that likes to crank your bass, there are many other cheaper alternatives out there, as heavy bass is what these were built for.
customer_reviews.author: andrew havens

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, absolutely amazing but poor built quality
customer_reviews.text: The only ear tips that fits me came like this, planning a return now
customer_reviews.author: Yiwei Y.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with purchase
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm thrilled with the clarity and soundstage, among other attributes of this fantastic set of IEM's. I'm waiting on a DAC to be delivered to bring them to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Reference IEMs to die for.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing comes nearly as close as these IEMs. I have tried lots. But for well rounded base, an equal amount of highs and balanced mids, this is it! But it would be an insult to engineering to listen to MP3s on these delights. trust me. Listen to "Watch Your Step" or "Sahara Sun" by Darshan Ambient on 24-bit/96KHz FLAC. Of course you will need the Onkyo HF player for iOS or Android.
customer_reviews.author: LinuxProphet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best evah! 3.12.19 — still think they are the best. Added a Bluetooth connection and while he sound is not quite as good, the convenience outways the small sound degradation. Alternate these with my B&O e8’s. Both are truly great.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t get better than this
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely superb sound quality. It doesn’t get better than this. Three years (and counting) of ownership, and I’m still continually impressed. There’s nothing better in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Pessimist

customer_reviews.title: Shure Headphones are Exceptional High Quality
customer_reviews.text: These Shure earphones are splendid and have changed the way I hear music from average to superlative sound. I wish they made hearing aids too.
customer_reviews.author: M. O. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound if you want in ear headphones with great ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound if you want in ear headphones with great sound and can afford them indulge yourself with these ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Jallison5

customer_reviews.title: They have fantastic sound in my ears and the block out all ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. I use these every day. They have fantastic sound in my ears and the block out all the noise. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing in ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Okay if your looking for a quality I in ear headphone!?...These are definitely those headphones!, the sound clarity and bass are like nothing you've ever heard for an in ear headphone. The price is worth every little bit if you want quality sound. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The best IEMs in the world
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly these are neutral. Nothing stands out or bites, everything is just RIGHT. The best IEMs in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr Gajos

customer_reviews.title: one of the best purchases ever
customer_reviews.text: one of the best purchases ever. I didn't know all my head phones and ear buds where crap until I tried these. believe me I only buy the best of everything. or so I thought until this. this is quite one of the best ear buds around. if you like music this is a must.
customer_reviews.author: John The Tool Guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful sound, but also a very accurate sounding earphone. Once you hear these, you won't want to listen to anything else.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD SAVAGE

customer_reviews.title: You can definitely get something similar if not better for half the price
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the price. Overrated. You can definitely get something similar if not better for half the price.I purchased the Sony XBA-Z5 and it is a lot better than this, at least in my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing I've ever heard in an in-ear bud comes close.
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of Sure 535's that I've loved for many years now. When I lost my last pair I struggled with trying to find something better. I read all the reviews but man, it was tough deciding to shell out a thousand bucks for ear-buds. All I can say is "wow". I'm no audiophile but I'm a very auditory person and though I can't find the eloquent words other reviewers used to describe these things, well, WOW. These blow the sure 535's away. And those were very very good. Now... I gotta check my homeowners policy in case I lose these puppies!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic IEMs, not much to be said that other ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic IEMs, not much to be said that other reviewers haven't already said. If you've got the means you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Finney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Although those earphones are incredibly expensive, they're totally worth it. The quality of the sound that they produce is out of this world. The subwoofer works perfectly. You can actually feel the earphones vibration with bass sounds. It's a must have for musicians that can afford that price. I am really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Havi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant - had shure 535 previously previously. These are much better - bass, clarity, wider/deeper soundstage.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile Pig

customer_reviews.title: Good quality IEM, on par with K3003
customer_reviews.text: It's on par with AKG K3003, however, they have different styles. Personally, I think K3003 is better in term of sound quality, it has a clearer sound compared to SE846 and the sound stage is better. However, the build-quality of SE846 is better than K3003 and I expect it to last longer than K3003.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clarity.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot describe to you how incredible these things are. If you need them, get them. there will be no regret. If you need to hear everything they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nag.Jon.in.Chi

customer_reviews.title: Smiling Awhile
customer_reviews.text: I'd waited awhile, months, before buying these earbuds. They arrived, and I find that they can bring smiling to one's face while listening, as other reviews have highlighted. Months ago arrived Bose (about $300) noise canceling earbuds, that are easy to carry around, and that are great for planes. But something was lacking in that I found myself not listening to music at the coffee shop, which had been a strong, regular practice with Bose over the ear noise canceling phones. For me these Shure buds maintain losing the bulk and weight of over the ear phones; and, if memory serves also add a deeper delight in the music, so back to the smiling.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but wow. I kick myself from time to time if what I heard is for real.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best headphone I ever listen in my life! Thank u Shure!
customer_reviews.author: Charles L

customer_reviews.title: An engineering marvel
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. I would rate them with 6 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: I use these with my in-ears monitoring system (also a ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these with my in-ears monitoring system (also a Shure product) as an upgrade from the SE215 earbuds that came with it. As one would expect upgrading from two to four drivers, the sound quality is drastically improved. I do not need to have the volume up as high in general, but hearing the other vocals above my own voice is considerably clearer, making harmonies much easier as well as singing lead. Instruments are much less muddy sounding, and adding bass to my monitor mix is now possible!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D

customer_reviews.title: amazing !!
customer_reviews.text: I had the SE 535 and this update is just great !! The quality of sound is amazing for music and it becomes even better with the movies !..... I worths the price !
customer_reviews.author: PRECLAIRE E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the best in ear headphones I have tried. Great depth and richness of sound, even with mp3s.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep falling off ear, not for day to day athlete
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, never heard anything like it! As great as these headphones are , my only complaint is that they keep falling off. I've tried different ear buds inserts but still it's become an annoyance... I would like to see Where develop headphones as great as this pair but with the day to day athlete in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound if you can afford this
customer_reviews.text: There are many choices & a lot of hype on the High End Audio. I think these sound excellent, but I am going to have to get custom ear molds to use them as designed (for my ears). They sound very good on my phone, iPads, but come alive on a Schiit Audio Valhalla 2 of Fio Portable budget amp.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBearLodge

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice earphone! For my own, it is better than K3003. Good at pop...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several different Shure IEMs over the years. I'm not a musician or an audiophile, but I like music and I like the way Shure makes it sound. If you can afford it and are willing to spend the money, you will be pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: George S. Williams III

customer_reviews.title: Great Earphones !!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Product. Great Low, mid and Highs. Couldn't take it out of my ears. Its so good. Usually Shure earphones doesn't fit my ear correctly. But this one fits fine. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Senthil Rajan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clarity. Even though I had expected excellence
customer_reviews.text: Amazing clarity. Even though I had expected excellence, this was well beyond that. The bass was clear, deep and resonant. Outstanding. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Crump

customer_reviews.title: Really overhyped
customer_reviews.text: These only get good reviews because these people that review them are new in the audiophile realm. These headphones sound muddy and soundstage is really small. You really want a good pair of earbuds get some ie800.
customer_reviews.author: angel of power

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not recommended if you think could blow you away
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price, while quality/price ratio is respectively not high. That is to say, when you spent $500 on an IEM, you get 80% of what you want; when you pay $1000, you get 90%. Definitely not recommended if you think could blow you away.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden G

customer_reviews.title: soundstage is good. I used them for my hemodialysis sessions but ...
customer_reviews.text: Professional packing job, heavy duty cases. I did try the different filters and settled on the black(smooth) one. Maybe I'm just spoiled with over the ear cans but these do have lots of detail and they sound a little bass shy, soundstage is good. I used them for my hemodialysis sessions but I've also used the Fostex TH-900 and I love the Fostex. I would use the Shure for traveling use. Don't know if it's worth the thousand bucks.
customer_reviews.author: wendell g smith

customer_reviews.title: Does not get better than this
customer_reviews.text: You're not going to hear the music, you're going to feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Worth to buy! But the right side of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth to buy! But the right side of the shorter cable donesn't have sound. Have to use the long one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Shen

customer_reviews.title: This is the best IEM on the market period
customer_reviews.text: This is the best IEM on the market period. I tried the Sennheiser IE800, and Westone W60. Neither comes close in musical reproduction and bass. Their biggest downside is the fit, they are bulky and while when you put them first they feel super comfortable, on extended listening period 1.5-2 hours plus hours your ears are literally in pain. If they fit you. you will never buy another IEM for a very long time! They are amazing to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing low end
customer_reviews.text: Bass player large venue contemporary Christian worship band. Amazing low end, can hear perfectly. Worth every penny. Would watch you tube video on maintenance, very helpful
customer_reviews.author: james d sutton

customer_reviews.title: I've had the se846 for a year and a half and love them. But not enough to write about cause ...
customer_reviews.text: first review ever. I've had the se846 for a year and a half and love them. But not enough to write about cause i never do. I just paired it with the oppo HA-2 and wow. Along with Tidal its just beyond... Better than my 25K home system. Amazing synergy.
customer_reviews.author: Iou Hoon Ahn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound
customer_reviews.text: Worth Every Penny!!! The low is awesome, the high is great and the human voice is just like from heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Dong

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, especially when used with the PONO music player in Balanced Mood.
customer_reviews.author: h@

customer_reviews.title: Incredible and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just your average guy that likes the best. I've had a pair of 535's for a few years and now I just purchased this pair of 846's. I can't add to the previous posts but I agree completely. The sounds is fantastic and I'm glad I spent 1K which at the time seemed a little nuts. Thanks Shure, it's a great experience and I spend 100 plus hours in an airplane seat every month, so the more I can relax and disassociate myself, the better.
customer_reviews.author: Stewsan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't as comfortable as I needed so had to take off for that.
customer_reviews.author: Zemit

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound
customer_reviews.text: I have had many expensive earphones in the past but they are really the best one till date. Even at this price,they are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: San Fran

customer_reviews.title: Balanced!
customer_reviews.text: Although se 846 is not incredibly fantastic in high/mid/bass, it has really great performance in every type of music! Recommend it if you have an ak120.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but I don't have a great ear.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this expensive earphones but sadly found out that my ear is not good enough to tell the difference from good earphone to bad earphone.
customer_reviews.author: rogers140

customer_reviews.title: but truth be told my ultimate ears tri-10s are better sounding. So I was disappointed but I already ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these headset expecting a miracle, but truth be told my ultimate ears tri-10s are better sounding. So I was disappointed but I already paid for them so I will have to live with them for now. Thank goodness there is nothing wrong with my ultimate ears triple-fi 10's.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months. $1000 down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 6 months until the left ear busted and is buzzing horrendously now. I don't even play these at high volume...haven't heard back from customer service.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you want the best non-custom earphones, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: YZ

customer_reviews.title: Love em!
customer_reviews.text: Would get 5 stars if not for price. Amazing piece of sound gear. Use it mainly for bike riding. Literally transport home sound system to the pavement. Not safe BTW!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: What's wrong with the quality? Terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: Left ear stopped working and I can't even detach the cable to check. At such a high price unbelievably low quality. Edit1: just received a replacement from Shure. Still unacceptable for such a reputable company and such expensive headphones to make the customer go through all this. Edit2: broken again 1 month after replacement (same problems). Absolutely the worst experience I've ever had with headphones. Wish I could get a refund
customer_reviews.author: anclave

customer_reviews.title: The best quality available to the public!
customer_reviews.text: Feels like you're in a studio & part of the music!! Your favorite music will come to life,new music also!
customer_reviews.author: laprimus

customer_reviews.title: Did I miss something?
customer_reviews.text: I got these after seeing rave reviews online and on the tube. I've allowed approx 20 hours 'burn in' time and have listened all genres of music. And I'm asking myself if I missed something (?). Don't take me wrong, they're not bad. But IMHO you can probably get better buds (or cans) for $1k.
customer_reviews.author: Arab Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Very good Earphones but expensive for the value
customer_reviews.text: One of the best (and more expensive) Earphones in the world: Clear low frequency, very nice medium and fantastic tweeter. But ... the relation between drivers is not perfect (perhaps the Earphones needs time) and finally, a Grado GR10 is less than 50% the price for a result which is more less as good as the Shure.
customer_reviews.author: V. Leost

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: They sound fantastic! Unfortunately they are uncomfortable and difficult to insert.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vanderlei

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Third pair of these headphones. I hoped the problem would not be present every time. Within one year, one of the ear bud leads will start shorting out. This has happened with three pairs now. It's not a matter of cleaning. Small adjustments will help for the short term. Very much not worth your money. Quality assurance and design issues. I will waste my time or money again with this product. Update: Within one year, left side is blown. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

product_meta.title: Shure SE846-CL Sound Isolating Earphones with Quad High Definition MicroDrivers and True Subwoofer
product_meta.description: Color:ClearWith four high-definition drivers, a groundbreaking low-pass filter, a customizable frequency response, and a detachable cable, The SE846 professional sound isolating earphones are engineered for unparalleled audio monitoring in a durable, discrete design. Secure, over the ear cable with wire form fit ensures earphones Stay in place and out of the way during hours of wear. Sound isolating technology with selection of sleeves blocks up to 37 dB of Outside noise and ensures custom, comfortable fit. Includes a premium carrying case, 1/4” adapter, fit kit with wide selection of sleeves, and nozzle removal tool with changeable inserts for frequency response adjustments. Designed to withstand the rigors of live performance.
feature_bullets: Four high-definition drivers provide extended high-end clarity and unparalleled low-end performance for a state-of-the-art listening experience
Three-way system configuration for dedicated low, mid and high frequency distribution
Groundbreaking low-pass filter provides the previously unattainable deep low-end performance of a true subwoofer—without sacrificing clarity or detail
Adjustable frequency response for customizable sound signatures with removable metal nozzle and changeable nozzle inserts (balanced, warm, and bright options included)

Sound Isolating design featuring fit kit with a variety of sleeves blocks up to 37 dB of Outside noise for immersive listening no matter where you are. Secure, over-the-ear design ensures earphones Stay in place and out of the way for unmatched, long-wearing comfort
Innovative detachable cable system for flexible connection and wearing options

Includes two standard 3. 5 mm audio cables (46” and 64”), basic fit kit, expanded fit kit (Yellow foam, Triple flange), 1/8” to ¼” stereo Adapter, removable nozzle Kit + nozzle tool, carrying pouch, cleaning Cloth and shirt clip
Note that the Clear hard case and airline adapter are no longer included
Convert Shure SE846 earphones to wireless with the new Bluetooth-enabled Cable (rmce-bt2). sold separately

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
